column4: they will now overwritge each other. but you wll have all aps for gnome and kde desktop. i.e. no of aps will increase
Meaning if a user bob installed opera browser, it'll show up in user dave?
what we installed from admin account wll show up in every normal account in both kde and gnome

I understand. I'm trying to figure out what's the best way to have all DE system for experiments without having them tied up together? I want the experiences of native KDE, native XFCE, native GNOME, etc...? Physical hard drives to swap around is one alternative. I don't want any virtuals.
what is de?
so you want to install gnome,kde, xfce but you dont want their aps to be grouped toghet? thats not possible.
Meh. So every users will have to see any new packages that are installed from other users.
not by other standarad users. but by other admin users
e.g. if bob install some software and bob is NOT admin then nobody else can see that software.
but if bot IS admin and he install any software then all wll see that software
Alright, I guess I'll opt for virtuals (for now). Maybe bunch of hard drives.
